column1: #Text=How many times have you seen your own death ?
#Text=Well , sadly , my best friend was killed this year .
#Text=I was his first friend when he came to New York to join The New York Times .
#Text=He lived in this house when he first came .
#Text=When he got married to his present widow , who I was with last night , I was the best man .
#Text=And the last year we traveled together as a foursome , his wife and mine .
#Text=Jean calls me up , " Some student in San Francisco ... he got killed just like that ! "
#Text=Now that is horrible , but that 's not so bad .
#Text=I would n't mind dying like that .
#Text=The way I would not want to die ...
#Text=every time I go flying I see the porters by the plane waiting for some old crippled person to get off the plane and then they roll them through the airport .
#Text=I do n't want to go like that .
#Text=You would n't want to be a Terri Schiavo .
#Text=I do n't even want to be a cripple who gets pushed across the airport !
#Text=I 'm just talking about infirm , getting along and ca n't walk .
#Text=That 's why I 'd like to go to Iraq .
#Text=Even if I was on Al-Jazeera with a gun to my head , I would n't be pleading with those bastards !
#Text=So he had to come up the steps outside where you did with his canes .
#Text=But in Austin with the campus there was someone who needed to push him in a chair .
#Text=That may happen to me soon enough , but I do n't like to think about it .

#Text=he finished his work , The Coldest Winter : America and the Korean War , was also thinking of another book and was in the process of researching it , and he gets rammed by a student who should n't have been driving him in the first place .
#Text=But he went out like that -- quick !
